intro: Ormosiopsis paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical ormosia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ormosiopsis paradoxa is considered a species of conservation concern.
